blurb_short: Develops and operates utility-scale solar farms across the Southwest United States. Currently managing 120 MW of installed capacity with a 300 MW pipeline under development.
blurb_medium: SolarEdge Systems is a leading developer and operator of utility-scale solar projects across Texas, Arizona, and New Mexico. The company focuses on brownfield and agricultural land conversions, partnering with rural communities to bring clean energy jobs and stable land lease income. With 120 MW currently operational and a robust 300 MW development pipeline, SolarEdge is positioned to triple capacity by 2026.

blurb_short: Develops and operates onshore wind farms across the Mountain West region. Portfolio includes 200 MW of operating capacity across Colorado, Wyoming, and Montana.
blurb_medium: WindFlow Energy is a pure-play onshore wind developer targeting the high-capacity wind corridors of the Mountain West. The company's projects benefit from Class 4-6 wind resources, among the best in North America, enabling capacity factors exceeding 40%. Their operating portfolio of 200 MW generates enough clean electricity to power 60,000 homes annually.

blurb_short: Manufactures low-carbon building materials including mass timber, recycled steel framing, and carbon-negative concrete. Serves commercial developers pursuing LEED and Living Building certifications.
blurb_medium: GreenBuild Materials is transforming the construction industry by providing sustainable alternatives to carbon-intensive building materials. Their product portfolio includes cross-laminated timber panels, recycled steel framing systems, and proprietary carbon-negative concrete. Materials have been specified in over 45 LEED Platinum projects.

blurb_short: Provides advanced water treatment and recycling systems for municipal and industrial customers in water-stressed regions. Technology enables 95% water recovery rates.
blurb_medium: AquaPure Technologies addresses critical water scarcity challenges through advanced treatment and recycling solutions. Their modular systems combine membrane filtration, UV disinfection, and AI-optimized operations to achieve industry-leading 95% water recovery rates. Installed base treats over 50 million gallons daily.

blurb_short: Operates regenerative farms and provides transition services to conventional farmers adopting sustainable practices. Managing 45,000 acres across Iowa, Nebraska, and Minnesota.
blurb_medium: TerraFarm Ag is pioneering the transition to regenerative agriculture at scale. The company operates 45,000 acres using practices that rebuild soil health, sequester carbon, and eliminate synthetic inputs. Their Transition-as-a-Service program helps conventional farmers adopt regenerative methods.
key_highlight: 45k acres managed | 0.5% annual soil carbon increase

blurb_short: Deploys and operates fast-charging stations for electric vehicles along major transportation corridors. Network includes 850 chargers across California, Nevada, and Arizona.
blurb_medium: EV GridLink is building critical charging infrastructure to support rapid EV adoption. The company focuses on Level 3 DC fast chargers strategically located along interstate highways and in urban charging deserts. Network serves over 15,000 charging sessions monthly with utilization 40% above industry benchmarks.

blurb_short: Designs and manufactures 100% recyclable and compostable packaging for e-commerce and food service. Serves major retailers seeking to eliminate single-use plastic.
blurb_medium: CircularPack is replacing single-use plastic packaging with sustainable alternatives that perform equally well at competitive prices. Product portfolio includes molded fiber mailers, compostable food containers, and paper-based cushioning. Packaging has displaced an estimated 18,000 tons of plastic waste.

blurb_short: Converts agricultural and food waste into renewable natural gas and organic fertilizer. Operating three anaerobic digestion facilities across the Southeast.
blurb_medium: BioEnergy Solutions transforms organic waste streams into valuable energy and agricultural products. Facilities process food waste from grocery chains, agricultural residues, and organic waste from manufacturers. Each facility produces renewable natural gas sold at premium prices plus nutrient-rich digestate as organic fertilizer.
